body:
Hi Stephen,

What does the `ssr` `noExternal` config do in `vite.config.js`? [Link here](https://github.com/StephenGunn/layoutprerender/blob/4040b1692af8f7eae4bc5b6c1ccc8718f0b1af28/vite.config.ts#L6-L10).

Could this be the cause of the problem? (I've no idea, but just curious as I was looking through the code and comparing it to a new skeleton project).
The project breaks without it. See https://github.com/sveltejs/kit/issues/6462

It seems to work fine with `prerender = 'auto'` but that doesn't really explain the problem.
Also, this is the error message when going to the layout prerendered page directly:
```
404
Not found: /episodes-1
Error: Not found: /episodes-1
    at resolve2 (file:///var/task/.svelte-kit/output/server/index.js:2514:18)
    at Object.options.hooks.handle (file:///var/task/.svelte-kit/output/server/index.js:2643:69)
    at respond (file:///var/task/.svelte-kit/output/server/index.js:2528:32)
    at processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:96:5)
```
Hope some of this info can help with resolving the issue.

Thanks for digging around @s3812497, I don't think that solution will work for me. I'll explain why:

Here is an episode page from the project that lead me to find this bug: https://craftroulette.live/episodes/episode-127

The version you're looking at is pre-route migration so everything is working. The layout file for the episode runs a couple of queries against the DB to get the gallery count, guest count, process video count, and extras gallery count and display them in the sidebar. I pre-render the layout on build so that site doesn't have to make those queries every time the episode is loaded.

Here is the catch, I need to keep some of the sub routes dynamic. So, the Contribution Gallery, Process Videos, and Extras Gallery pages are all dynamic because they allow people to submit to them and I don't want to have to rebuild the entire project after every submission. The numbers on the menu do get out of sync until the next build but that's not a big deal.

So as far as I know, I can't just specify the episode to be static because I have dynamic sub-pages.

I have the site ready to publish with the routing migration done and everything else up-to-date.. but the prerender = true was breaking the sub-routes on that page. It took me a few days to figure out what was going on, and that's when I build the tester project to make sure.

> Here is the catch, I need to keep some of the sub routes dynamic. So, the Contribution Gallery, Process Videos, and ExtrasGallery pages are all dynamic because they allow people to submit to them and I don't want to have to rebuild the entire project after every submission. The numbers on the menu do get out of sync until the next build but that's not a big deal.
> 
> So as far as I know, I can't just specify the episode to be static because I have dynamic sub-pages.

If I understand this correctly, you could try adding a [group layout](https://kit.svelte.dev/docs/advanced-routing#advanced-layouts-group) for your dynamic sub-pages and add a `prerender = false` to the layout, affecting all the routes under it.
Example:
```
my-project/
├ src/
│ ├ routes/
│ │ ├ episodes-[number]/
│ │ │ ├ (dynamic)/ // add any routes here to get the layout's settings
│ │ │ │ ├ gallery/
│ │ │ │ ├ videos/
│ │ │ │ └ +layout.svelte // <slot/>
│ │ │ │ └ +layout.ts // export const prerender = false
│ │ └ +page.svelte
│ │ └ +layout.server.ts
│ │ └ +layout.svelte
```

> @s3812497 thanks. I will try this.
> 
> Question- I have not used the svelte.config.js prerender option before, will this affect the pages that I already have prerender = true set? Can I set it at the config level AND the route level? The majority of the routes are set to prerender.

I've never used the option before either, but I would assume the `entries` option would be in addition to per-route configuration.

> Should I just set
> 
> ```
> prerender: {
>     default: true
> },
> ```
> 
> and then specify all of the paths I don't want to pre-render? Might be easier?

Sounds like the right way to go :)

So,

```
prerender: {
    default: true
},
```

has been removed, according to the error I got during build, but is still in the docs.

and any route that I tried to specify with
`entries` that had a parameter in the route, failed:

```
[vite-plugin-svelte-kit] Prerendering failed with code 1
error during build:
Error: Prerendering failed with code 1
    at ChildProcess.<anonymous> (file:///home/stephen/Projects/craftroulette/node_modules/.pnpm/@sveltejs+kit@1.0.0-next.468_qevq5tvhizyxp44gfhkn6m3ljq/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/exports/vite/index.js:435:15)
    at ChildProcess.emit (node:events:513:28)
    at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (node:internal/child_process:291:12)
 ELIFECYCLE  Command failed with exit code 1.

```

I think I was closer before but it was worth the shot.

> So,
> 
> ```
> prerender: {
>     default: true
> },
> ```
> 
> has been removed, according to the error I got during build, but is still in the docs.

Ah, right. I think it got removed in favour of just adding a `prerender = true` to the main layout in your application, thus affecting all routes.
 
> and any route that I tried to specify with `entries` that had a parameter in the route, failed:
> 
> ```
> [vite-plugin-svelte-kit] Prerendering failed with code 1
> error during build:
> Error: Prerendering failed with code 1
>     at ChildProcess.<anonymous> (file:///home/stephen/Projects/craftroulette/node_modules/.pnpm/@sveltejs+kit@1.0.0-next.468_qevq5tvhizyxp44gfhkn6m3ljq/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/exports/vite/index.js:435:15)
>     at ChildProcess.emit (node:events:513:28)
>     at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (node:internal/child_process:291:12)
>  ELIFECYCLE  Command failed with exit code 1.
> ```

Can you post more of the error log? If you scroll up a bit more, the actual error has a more descriptive error message that will explain why the prerendering process failed and for which page.

I'm not having any luck using the prerender config object.. Here is the full error when trying to specify my episodes route:

```
file:///home/stephen/Projects/craftroulette/node_modules/.pnpm/@sveltejs+kit@1.0.0-next.468_qevq5tvhizyxp44gfhkn6m3ljq/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/core/prerender/prerender.js:50
                                throw new Error(format_error(details, config));
                                      ^
Error: 404 /episodes/episode-[number=integer]
    at file:///home/stephen/Projects/craftroulette/node_modules/.pnpm/@sveltejs+kit@1.0.0-next.468_qevq5tvhizyxp44gfhkn6m3ljq/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/core/prerender/prerender.js:50:11
    at save (file:///home/stephen/Projects/craftroulette/node_modules/.pnpm/@sveltejs+kit@1.0.0-next.468_qevq5tvhizyxp44gfhkn6m3ljq/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/core/prerender/prerender.js:355:4)
    at visit (file:///home/stephen/Projects/craftroulette/node_modules/.pnpm/@sveltejs+kit@1.0.0-next.468_qevq5tvhizyxp44gfhkn6m3ljq/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/core/prerender/prerender.js:232:3)
[vite-plugin-svelte-kit] Prerendering failed with code 1
error during build:
Error: Prerendering failed with code 1
    at ChildProcess.<anonymous> (file:///home/stephen/Projects/craftroulette/node_modules/.pnpm/@sveltejs+kit@1.0.0-next.468_qevq5tvhizyxp44gfhkn6m3ljq/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/exports/vite/index.js:435:15)
    at ChildProcess.emit (node:events:513:28)
    at Process.ChildProcess._handle.onexit (node:internal/child_process:291:12)
 ELIFECYCLE  Command failed with exit code 1.
```
So a 404- I also tried '*' with crawl: true and it didn't pre-render anything. I also tried leaving out the =integer part on the route and that 404'd.

I'm probably going to give this a rest for now and hope this gets fixed soon. :)

> ```
> file:///home/stephen/Projects/craftroulette/node_modules/.pnpm/@sveltejs+kit@1.0.0-next.468_qevq5tvhizyxp44gfhkn6m3ljq/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/core/prerender/prerender.js:50
>                                 throw new Error(format_error(details, config));
>                                       ^
> Error: 404 /episodes/episode-[number=integer]
>     at file:///home/stephen/Projects/craftroulette/node_modules/.pnpm/@sveltejs+kit@1.0.0-next.468_qevq5tvhizyxp44gfhkn6m3ljq/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/core/prerender/prerender.js:50:11
>     at save (file:///home/stephen/Projects/craftroulette/node_modules/.pnpm/@sveltejs+kit@1.0.0-next.468_qevq5tvhizyxp44gfhkn6m3ljq/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/core/prerender/prerender.js:355:4)
>     at visit (file:///home/stephen/Projects/craftroulette/node_modules/.pnpm/@sveltejs+kit@1.0.0-next.468_qevq5tvhizyxp44gfhkn6m3ljq/node_modules/@sveltejs/kit/src/core/prerender/prerender.js:232:3)
> ```

It's weird that it can't find the route. What's the structure of your routes?

> So a 404- I also tried '*' with crawl: true and it didn't pre-render anything.

In the docs, it mentions the `'*'` value for `entries` doesn't include dynamic routes (must be why it ignores your routes).
> The * string includes all non-dynamic routes (i.e. pages with no [parameters] )
https://kit.svelte.dev/docs/configuration#prerender

I'd recommend adding a `prerender = true` to your home page layout instead.

Ok, I think adding prerender = true to the root +layout.server.ts and then specifying prerender = false on the routes I want to keep dynamic worked. I'll keep playing with it and make sure this works for me. 

Thank you for helping me!

The original bug still exists though so I'm going to leave this open.

Just as a follow up- my site was acting weird before I realized that putting prerender = true in the +layout.server.ts prevented my UI from having logged in / logged out state. So I reverted again and I will wait until the original problem is fixed.

> Just as a follow up- my site was acting weird before I realized that putting prerender = true in the +layout.server.ts prevented my UI from having logged in / logged out state. So I reverted again and I will wait until the original problem is fixed.

That's what prerender does. It runs all the `layout` and `page` `load` functions for the specified route at runtime, then builds a HTML file for that page using the values returned from load. Thus, the HTML file is served when users go to that route, and no load functions are run.

I think you may not want to prerender your pages, or you'll want to check for the logged in / logged out state outside the `load` function.

I am only trying to pre-render pages that don't need to check for logged in / logged out state in the load function. What's happening to me is any page that has a /+page.server.ts that is set to prerender is overwriting the $page.data store completely when I navigate to it. I don't know if that is intended behavior.

I followed the discussion thread about removing the session store where Rich suggested using the root level /+layout.server.ts to pass event.locals to the front-end. 

I'm guessing that I need to create my own session store and pass the user object / auth state to that on login and use that session store to determine my UI state. Does that sound right?

> What's happening to me is any page that has a /+page.server.ts that is set to prerender is overwriting the $page.data store completely when I navigate to it. I don't know if that is intended behavior.

It should overwrite the `+page` data but retain the `+layout` data if the pages share the same layout.

> I followed the discussion thread about removing the session store where Rich suggested using the root level /+layout.server.ts to pass event.locals to the front-end.
> 
> I'm guessing that I need to create my own session store and pass the user object / auth state to that on login and use that session store to determine my UI state. Does that sound right?

You can [re-create the session store](https://www.captaincodeman.com/re-creating-the-sveltekit-session-store) and use it to keep track of auth state. Personally, I have been using just the layout `load` function and the `data` returned.

> It should overwrite the `+page` data but retain the `+layout` data if the pages share the same layout.

That is exactly what I am expecting but not seeing. I made a quick video to show you what is happening:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7240548/188493836-09b232ff-879a-4f8f-8b17-6f36b4a08b6e.mp4

I really want to know what is happening rather than just writing a workaround. Any thoughts?

thanks again

>  2022-09-05.12-05-55.mp4 

Is this running with `dev` or `preview`? If in `dev`, is it fixed when you remove the `prerender` option?

The video is the production version live on www.craftroulette.live - it works as intended on dev. And yes, removing the prerender = true solves the issue. Here is a video where the only altered code between the two videos is setting prerender = false on the page that reset my page.data earlier

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7240548/188498139-a0866533-bea7-49dd-8f07-10dd3dbfb35d.mp4

I will just set all my prerenders to false for the time being. I guess this is a bug?
